made
create

data.chText: 制作面包；生产水泥 / 纸张

She makes her own clothes.
Wine is made from grapes.
The grapes are made into wine.

data.chText: 你的衬衣是用什么做的？
data.enText: What's your shirt made of?
made in France (= on a label)

data.chText: 她给我们大家冲了咖啡。

data.enText: She made coffee for us all.

data.chText: 她给我们大家冲了咖啡。
data.enText: She made us all coffee.
to write, create or prepare sth

data.enText: These regulations were made to protect children.

data.chText: 我的律师一直在催促我立遗嘱。
data.enText: My lawyer has been urging me to make a will.

data.chText: 她已经出了好几部电影。
data.enText: She has made (= directed or acted in) several movies.
a bed
to arrange a bed so that it is neat and ready for use

data.chText: 使显得 / 出现 / 成为 / 做
data.enText: cause to appear/happen/become/do
to cause sth to appear as a result of breaking, tearing, hitting or removing material
The stone made a dent in the roof of the car.

data.chText: 布上的窟窿是虫子蛀的。
data.enText: The holes in the cloth were made by moths.
to cause sth to exist, happen or be done

data.chText: 产生噪音；弄糟；小题大作

data.chText: 她努力给主持面试者留个好印象。
data.enText: She tried to make a good impression on the interviewer.
I keep making the same mistakes .
to cause sb/sth to be or become sth

data.chText: 这则消息使他非常高兴。
data.enText: The news made him very happy.
She made her objections clear.
He made it clear that he objected.

data.chText: 全部情况从未公之于世。
data.enText: The full story was never made public .

data.chText: 你能用俄语表达你的意思吗？
data.enText: Can you make yourself understood in Russian?

data.chText: 车辆噪音很大，她无法让人听到她的声音。
data.enText: She couldn't make herself heard above the noise of the traffic.

data.chText: 恐怖分子宣称游客将成为他们袭击的目标。
data.enText: The terrorists made it known that tourists would be targeted.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+不带to的不定式

data.enText: to cause sb/sth to do sth
She always makes me laugh.
This dress makes me look fat.
What makes you say that (= why do you think so) ?

data.chText: 什么也改变不了我的主意。
data.enText: Nothing will make me change my mind.
to cause sb/sth to be or become sth

data.chText: 这不太重要——我不想把它当回事儿。
data.enText: This isn't very important─I don't want to make an issue of it .
Don't make a habit of it .

data.chText: 你把这件事儿搞得一团糟。
data.enText: You've made a terrible mess of this job.

data.chText: 在一生中有所成就是很重要的。
data.enText: It's important to try and make something of (= achieve sth in) your life.

data.chText: 早晚有一天，我们会让你成为一名网球选手的。
data.enText: We'll make a tennis player of you yet.

data.chText: 把房子粉刷了一遍，这就是我的夏季工程。

data.enText: I made painting the house my project for the summer.

data.chText: 她一定要查清楚到底该谁负责。
data.enText: She made it her business to find out who was responsible.
a decision/guess/comment, etc.
to decide, guess, etc. sth
Come on! It's time we made a start.

data.text: Make can be used in this way with a number of different nouns. These expressions are included at the entry for each noun.
make可以和许多名词这样搭配使用，表达方式列在各有关名词词条下。

data.enText: force
to force sb to do sth

data.chText: 他们非让我把整个事件再说一遍。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+不带to的不定式

data.enText: They made me repeat the whole story.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She must be made to comply with the rules.

data.text: This pattern is only used in the passive.
此句型仅用于被动语态。

data.chText: 他从不收拾自己的房间，而他妈也从不要求他收拾。
data.enText: He never cleans his room and his mother never tries to make him.
represent
to represent sb/sth as being or doing sth

data.chText: 你把我的鼻子画得太大了。
data.enText: You've made my nose too big (= for example in a drawing) .

data.chText: 他把李尔王刻画成一位真正的悲剧人物。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He makes King Lear a truly tragic figure.
appoint

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to elect or choose sb as sth
She made him her assistant.
be suitable
to become or develop into sth; to be suitable for sth

data.chText: 她本可以成为一位出色的教师。
data.enText: She would have made an excellent teacher.

data.chText: 这间屋子做办公室挺不错。
data.enText: This room would make a nice office.
equal
to add up to or equal sth
5 and 7 make 12.
A hundred cents make one euro.
to be a total of sth

data.chText: 他这已经是第三次未通过驾驶考试了！
data.enText: That makes the third time he's failed his driving test!
money
to earn or gain money
She makes $100 000 a year.
to make a profit/loss
We need to think of ways to make money .

data.chText: 他在股票市场发了大财。
data.enText: He made a fortune on the stock market.
He makes a living as a stand-up comic.
calculate

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to think or calculate sth to be sth
What time do you make it ?
I make that exactly $50.
reach
to manage to reach or go to a place or position

data.chText: 你觉得我们12点前能到多佛吗？
data.enText: Do you think we'll make Dover by 12?

data.chText: 很抱歉，昨晚没能参加你们的聚会。
data.enText: I'm sorry I couldn't make your party last night.

data.chText: 他绝不可能成为此队队员。
data.enText: He'll never make (= get a place in) the team.

data.chText: 这件事登在了全国性报纸的头版。
data.enText: The story made (= appeared on) the front pages of the national newspapers.
We just managed to make the deadline (= to finish sth in time) .
sth successful
to cause sth to be a success
Good wine can make a meal.

data.chText: 这消息确实使我一天都很愉快。
data.enText: The news really made my day .

data.chText: 大多数含 make 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 make merry 在词条 merry 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing make are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example make merry is at merry .
make as if to do sth
to make a movement that makes it seem as if you are just going to do sth
He made as if to speak.
make do (with sth)
to manage with sth that is not really good enough

data.chText: 我们很匆忙，只好将就着来了点小吃。
data.enText: We were in a hurry so we had to make do with a quick snack.
make good
to become rich and successful
make sth good
to pay for, replace or repair sth that has been lost or damaged
She promised to make good the damage.

data.chText: 履行，执行（曾承诺、威胁等的事）
data.enText: to do sth that you have promised, threatened, etc. to do
make it
to be successful in your career

data.chText: 他从来就不是一个成功的演员。
data.enText: He never really made it as an actor.

data.chText: （尤指在困难情况下）准时到达
data.enText: to succeed in reaching a place in time, especially when this is difficult

data.chText: 再过二十分钟飞机就起飞了，咱们无论如何也赶不上了。
data.enText: The flight leaves in twenty minutes─we'll never make it.
to be able to be present at a place

data.chText: 很抱歉，星期六我不能出席。
data.enText: I'm sorry I won't be able to make it (= for example, to a party) on Saturday.
to survive after a serious illness or accident; to deal successfully with a difficult experience
The doctors think he's going to make it.

data.chText: 我不知道自己是怎么熬过那个星期的。
data.enText: I don't know how I made it through the week.
make it with sb
to have sex with sb
make like…

data.chText: （为给别人留下印象）假装，装出…样子
data.enText: to pretend to be, know or have sth in order to impress people

data.chText: 他装模作样，仿佛自己是有史以来最棒的演员。
data.enText: He makes like he's the greatest actor of all time.
make the most of sth/sb/yourself
to gain as much advantage, enjoyment, etc. as you can from sb/sth

data.chText: 这是我第一次出国，我要充分利用这个机会。
data.enText: It's my first trip abroad so I'm going to make the most of it.

data.chText: 她不知道如何充分表现自己。
data.enText: She doesn't know how to make the most of herself (= make herself appear in the best possible way) .
make much of sth/sb
to treat sth/sb as very important

data.chText: 他总是非常在意他卑微的出身。
data.enText: He always makes much of his humble origins.
make or break sth
to be the thing that makes sb/sth either a success or a failure

data.chText: 这部电影将要决定他当导演是行还是不行。
data.enText: This movie will make or break him as a director.

data.chText: 这是公司盛衰的关键时刻。
data.enText: It's make-or-break time for the company.
make something of yourself
to be successful in your life
make for sth
to move towards sth
to help to make sth possible

data.chText: 不断争吵不可能使婚姻幸福。
data.enText: Constant arguing doesn't make for a happy marriage.
make sb/sth into sb/sth
to change sb/sth into sb/sth

data.chText: 我们要把阁楼改装一下，增加一间卧室。
data.enText: We're making our attic into an extra bedroom.
make sth of sb/sth
to understand the meaning or character of sb/sth

data.chText: 你明白那都是什么意思吗？
data.enText: What do you make of it all?

data.chText: 我根本不懂这封短信的意思。
data.enText: I can't make anything of this note.

data.chText: 这位新经理，我不知道怎么评价他才好。
data.enText: I don't know what to make of (= think of) the new manager.
make off

data.chText: 匆忙离开；（尤指）仓皇逃跑
data.enText: to hurry away, especially in order to escape
make off with sth
to steal sth and hurry away with it
make out

data.chText: （询问是否处理得当）应付，度过
data.enText: used to ask if sb managed well or was successful in a particular situation

data.chText: 他妻子不在家时他是怎么过的？
data.enText: How did he make out while his wife was away?

data.chText: 亲吻抚摸（某人）；（与某人）性交
data.enText: to kiss and touch sb in a sexual way; to have sex with sb
make sb out
to understand sb's character
make sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 看清；听清；分清；辨认清楚
data.enText: to manage to see sb/sth or read or hear sth

data.chText: 黑暗中我只看出了一个人的轮廓。
data.enText: I could just make out a figure in the darkness.

data.chText: 我能听到说话的声音，却听不清他们在说什么。
data.enText: I could hear voices but I couldn't make out what they were saying.
to say that sth is true when it may not be

data.chText: 她并不像人们说的那样富有。
data.enText: She's not as rich as people make out.
He made out that he had been robbed.

data.chText: 她说自己多么聪明，未免言过其实。
data.enText: She makes herself out to be smarter than she really is.
make sth↔out
to write out or complete a form or document

data.chText: 他开了一张100欧元的支票。
data.enText: He made out a cheque for €100.

data.chText: 医生给我开了一张处方。
data.enText: The doctor made out a prescription for me.

before.enText: used in negative sentences and questions

data.enText: to understand sth; to see the reasons for sth
How do you make that out (= what are your reasons for thinking that) ?
I can't make out what she wants.
make sth↔over (to sb/sth)
to legally give sth to sb

data.chText: 他把财产传给了他的长子。
data.enText: He made over the property to his eldest son.

data.chText: 改造；修饰；彻底改变形象
data.enText: to change sth in order to make it look different or use it for a different purpose; to give sb a different appearance by changing their clothes, hair, etc.
make towards sth
to start moving towards sth
He made towards the door.
make up
make yourself/sb↔up
to put powder, lipstick , etc. on your/sb's face to make it more attractive or to prepare for an appearance in the theatre, on television, etc.
make sth↔up
to form sth
Women make up 56% of the student numbers.
to put sth together from several different things
to invent a story, etc., especially in order to trick or entertain sb

data.chText: 他编了个借口，说他的女儿病了。
data.enText: He made up some excuse about his daughter being sick.

data.chText: 我给孩子们讲了个故事，是现编的。
data.enText: I told the kids a story, making it up as I went along.
You made that up!
to complete a number or an amount required

data.chText: 我们还需要一个人才能组成一个队。
data.enText: We need one more person to make up a team.

data.chText: 补上（失去的东西）；作出补偿
data.enText: to replace sth that has been lost; to compensate for sth

data.chText: 我今天下午早点儿走，明天补上这段时间，可以吗？
data.enText: Can I leave early this afternoon and make up the time tomorrow?
to prepare a medicine by mixing different things together
to prepare a bed for use; to create a temporary bed

data.chText: 我们在空着没用的屋里搭了张床。
data.enText: We made up the bed in the spare room.

data.chText: 他们给我在沙发上铺了个床。
data.enText: They made up a bed for me on the sofa.
make up for sth
to do sth that corrects a bad situation

data.chText: 失去一个孩子是任何东西都无法弥补的。
data.enText: Nothing can make up for the loss of a child.

data.chText: 耽搁了这么久，我们急着想弥补失去的时间。
data.enText: After all the delays, we were anxious to make up for lost time .

data.chText: 她的热情弥补了她经验的不足。
data.enText: Her enthusiasm makes up for her lack of experience.
make up (to sb) for sth
to do sth for sb or give them sth because you have caused them trouble, suffering or disappointment and wish to show that you are sorry

data.chText: 我这样对你，该怎么向你表示歉意呢？
data.enText: How can I make up for the way I've treated you?

data.chText: 我保证我一定会补偿你的。
data.enText: I'll make it up to you , I promise.
make up to sb
to be pleasant to sb, praise them, etc. especially in order to get an advantage for yourself
make up (with sb)
make it up
to end a disagreement with sb and become friends again

data.chText: 你们两个干吗不和好算了？
data.enText: Why don't you two kiss and make up ?
Has he made it up with her yet?
Have they made it up yet?
the name or type of a machine, piece of equipment, etc. that is made by a particular company

data.chText: 他开的是什么品牌的车？
data.enText: What make of car does he drive?

data.chText: 有很多不同的型号可供选择。
data.enText: There are so many different makes to choose from.
a Swiss make of watch
on the make
trying to get money or an advantage for yourself

data.text: make ♦ create ♦ develop ♦ produce ♦ generate ♦ form

data.chText: 以上各词均含制造、使产生之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to make sth from parts or materials, or to cause sth to exist or happen.
make
to create or prepare sth by combining materials or putting parts together; to cause sth to exist or happen
She makes her own clothes.

data.chText: 她给主持面试者留下了很好的印象。
data.enText: She made a good impression on the interviewer.
create
to make sth exist or happen, especially sth new that did not exist before

data.chText: 科学家对宇宙是怎样形成的有分歧。
data.enText: Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.

data.chText: make较通用，较常用以指物质的东西，如制造桌子、做衣服、做蛋糕通常用make，但创造就业机会/财富用create。要强调某物品或实体事物是原创的或不同寻常，也可用create：
data.enText: Make is a more general word and is more often used for physical things: you would usually make a table/dress/cake but create jobs/wealth . You can use create for sth physical in order to emphasize how original or unusual the object is.

data.chText: 品尝一下这道新菜吧，是我们厨师长首创的。
data.enText: Try this new dish, created by our head chef.
make or create?
develop

data.chText: （尤用于商务语境）开发，研制（产品）：
data.enText: (used especially in business contexts) to think of and produce a new product
to develop new software
produce

data.chText: 指生产、制造（商品）；（运用技巧）制作、造出：
data.enText: to make things to be sold; to create sth using skill
a factory that produces microchips
generate

data.chText: 指创造、产生（电、财富或主意）：
data.enText: to produce or create sth, especially power, money or ideas
to generate electricity

data.chText: 集思广益是出主意的好办法。
data.enText: Brainstorming is a good way of generating ideas.
form
[often passive] to make sth from sth else; to make sth into sth else

data.chText: 重新排列字母，组成另一单词。
data.enText: Rearrange the letters to form a new word.

data.chText: 这根链条由136个链节组成。
data.enText: The chain is formed from 136 links.
to make/create/develop/produce/generate/form sth from/out of sth
to make/form sth into sth
to make/produce wine
to create/develop a new product
to create/produce/generate income/profits/wealth
to produce/generate electricity/heat/power

data.text: household jobs: do or make?家务活：用do还是make？

data.chText: 做家务活可用下列短语表示：wash the dishes（洗餐具）、clean the kitchen floor（擦洗厨房地板）、set the table（摆餐具）等，在口语中常用动词do取代：
data.enText: To talk about jobs in the home you can use such phrases as wash the dishes , clean the kitchen floor , set the table , etc. In conversation the verb do is often used instead.
Let me do the dishes.

data.chText: 迈克尔说他来擦洗厨房地板。
data.enText: Michael said he would do the kitchen floor.
It’s your turn to do the table.

data.chText: do常与以 -ing结尾的名词连用：
data.enText: Do is often used with nouns ending -ing .

data.chText: 买东西；打扫卫生；熨衣服；用吸尘器吸尘
data.enText: to do the shopping/cleaning/ironing/vacuuming

data.chText: 动词make尤用于铺床（make the beds）、准备或烹调食物等词语中：
data.enText: The verb make is used especially in the phrase make the beds and when you are talking about preparing or cooking food.
He makes a great lasagne.
I’ll make breakfast while you’re having a shower.

data.chText: 做饭亦可用get、get ready和fix（尤用于北美英语）等词：
data.enText: You can also say get , get ready and, especially in NAmE , fix for preparing meals.

data.chText: 我弄孩子上床睡觉时你做饭行吗？
data.enText: Can you get dinner while I put the kids to bed?
Sit down─I’ll fix supper for you.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，泛指完成动作、行为等。

ex.chText: 我想你该开始清扫房间了。
ex.enText: I suppose you should make a start on cleaning the room.

synonyms.bx: 常与某些名词连用，表示某人做某事。

ex.chText: 这个手术是由一位年轻医生完成的。
ex.enText: The operation was performed by a young doctor.
The little boy is good at performing calculations.

synonyms.bx: 尤指完成有用的或难度较大的事情。

ex.enText: He earned plenty of money last year.

ex.chText: 我以前靠修剪草坪赚钱。
ex.enText: I used to earn money by mowing lawns.

ex.chText: 他们的电视作品一定让他们赚了不少钱。
ex.enText: Their television work must have earned them good money.

synonyms.bx: 指因提供某种服务或从事某种劳动或工作而获得报酬。

ex.chText: 他每年的净收入是5万美元。
这些货物可以净赚10万元。

ex.enText: The new manager gets/earns 500,000 yuan a year.

ex.chText: 她整理货架一小时挣3美元。
ex.enText: She gets/earns $3 an hour for stacking shelves.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可指以任何方式挣钱，在日常用语中可与 earn 换用。

ex.enText: You need to think of ways to make/earn money.
Cooper made/earned a fortune on the stock market.

synonyms.bx: 与 earn 基本同义，常可换用。

data.chText: 大多数含 make 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 make merry 在词条 merry 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing make are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example make merry is at merry .
make as if to do sth
to make a movement that makes it seem as if you are just going to do sth
He made as if to speak.
make do (with sth)
to manage with sth that is not really good enough

data.chText: 我们很匆忙，只好将就着来了点小吃。
data.enText: We were in a hurry so we had to make do with a quick snack.
make good
to become rich and successful
make sth good
to pay for, replace or repair sth that has been lost or damaged
She promised to make good the damage.

data.chText: 履行，执行（曾承诺、威胁等的事）
data.enText: to do sth that you have promised, threatened, etc. to do
make it
to be successful in your career

data.chText: 他从来就不是一个成功的演员。
data.enText: He never really made it as an actor.

data.chText: （尤指在困难情况下）准时到达
data.enText: to succeed in reaching a place in time, especially when this is difficult

data.chText: 再过二十分钟飞机就起飞了，咱们无论如何也赶不上了。
data.enText: The flight leaves in twenty minutes─we'll never make it.
to be able to be present at a place

data.chText: 很抱歉，星期六我不能出席。
data.enText: I'm sorry I won't be able to make it (= for example, to a party) on Saturday.
to survive after a serious illness or accident; to deal successfully with a difficult experience
The doctors think he's going to make it.

data.chText: 我不知道自己是怎么熬过那个星期的。
data.enText: I don't know how I made it through the week.
make it with sb
to have sex with sb
make like…

data.chText: （为给别人留下印象）假装，装出…样子
data.enText: to pretend to be, know or have sth in order to impress people

data.chText: 他装模作样，仿佛自己是有史以来最棒的演员。
data.enText: He makes like he's the greatest actor of all time.
make the most of sth/sb/yourself
to gain as much advantage, enjoyment, etc. as you can from sb/sth

data.chText: 这是我第一次出国，我要充分利用这个机会。
data.enText: It's my first trip abroad so I'm going to make the most of it.

data.chText: 她不知道如何充分表现自己。
data.enText: She doesn't know how to make the most of herself (= make herself appear in the best possible way) .
make much of sth/sb
to treat sth/sb as very important

data.chText: 他总是非常在意他卑微的出身。
data.enText: He always makes much of his humble origins.
make or break sth
to be the thing that makes sb/sth either a success or a failure

data.chText: 这部电影将要决定他当导演是行还是不行。
data.enText: This movie will make or break him as a director.

data.chText: 这是公司盛衰的关键时刻。
data.enText: It's make-or-break time for the company.
make something of yourself
to be successful in your life
on the make
trying to get money or an advantage for yourself
make for sth
to move towards sth
to help to make sth possible

data.chText: 不断争吵不可能使婚姻幸福。
data.enText: Constant arguing doesn't make for a happy marriage.
make sb/sth into sb/sth
to change sb/sth into sb/sth

data.chText: 我们要把阁楼改装一下，增加一间卧室。
data.enText: We're making our attic into an extra bedroom.
make sth of sb/sth
to understand the meaning or character of sb/sth

data.chText: 你明白那都是什么意思吗？
data.enText: What do you make of it all?

data.chText: 我根本不懂这封短信的意思。
data.enText: I can't make anything of this note.

data.chText: 这位新经理，我不知道怎么评价他才好。
data.enText: I don't know what to make of (= think of) the new manager.
make off

data.chText: 匆忙离开；（尤指）仓皇逃跑
data.enText: to hurry away, especially in order to escape
make off with sth
to steal sth and hurry away with it
make out

data.chText: （询问是否处理得当）应付，度过
data.enText: used to ask if sb managed well or was successful in a particular situation

data.chText: 他妻子不在家时他是怎么过的？
data.enText: How did he make out while his wife was away?

data.chText: 亲吻抚摸（某人）；（与某人）性交
data.enText: to kiss and touch sb in a sexual way; to have sex with sb
make sb out
to understand sb's character
make sb/sth↔out

data.chText: 看清；听清；分清；辨认清楚
data.enText: to manage to see sb/sth or read or hear sth

data.chText: 黑暗中我只看出了一个人的轮廓。
data.enText: I could just make out a figure in the darkness.

data.chText: 我能听到说话的声音，却听不清他们在说什么。
data.enText: I could hear voices but I couldn't make out what they were saying.
to say that sth is true when it may not be

data.chText: 她并不像人们说的那样富有。
data.enText: She's not as rich as people make out.
He made out that he had been robbed.

data.chText: 她说自己多么聪明，未免言过其实。
data.enText: She makes herself out to be smarter than she really is.
make sth↔out
to write out or complete a form or document

data.chText: 他开了一张100欧元的支票。
data.enText: He made out a cheque for €100.

data.chText: 医生给我开了一张处方。
data.enText: The doctor made out a prescription for me.

before.enText: used in negative sentences and questions

data.enText: to understand sth; to see the reasons for sth
How do you make that out (= what are your reasons for thinking that) ?
I can't make out what she wants.
make sth↔over (to sb/sth)
to legally give sth to sb

data.chText: 他把财产传给了他的长子。
data.enText: He made over the property to his eldest son.

data.chText: 改造；修饰；彻底改变形象
data.enText: to change sth in order to make it look different or use it for a different purpose; to give sb a different appearance by changing their clothes, hair, etc.
make towards sth
to start moving towards sth
He made towards the door.
make up
make yourself/sb↔up
to put powder, lipstick , etc. on your/sb's face to make it more attractive or to prepare for an appearance in the theatre, on television, etc.
make sth↔up
to form sth
Women make up 56% of the student numbers.
to put sth together from several different things
to invent a story, etc., especially in order to trick or entertain sb

data.chText: 他编了个借口，说他的女儿病了。
data.enText: He made up some excuse about his daughter being sick.

data.chText: 我给孩子们讲了个故事，是现编的。
data.enText: I told the kids a story, making it up as I went along.
You made that up!
to complete a number or an amount required

data.chText: 我们还需要一个人才能组成一个队。
data.enText: We need one more person to make up a team.

data.chText: 补上（失去的东西）；作出补偿
data.enText: to replace sth that has been lost; to compensate for sth

data.chText: 我今天下午早点儿走，明天补上这段时间，可以吗？
data.enText: Can I leave early this afternoon and make up the time tomorrow?
to prepare a medicine by mixing different things together
to prepare a bed for use; to create a temporary bed

data.chText: 我们在空着没用的屋里搭了张床。
data.enText: We made up the bed in the spare room.

data.chText: 他们给我在沙发上铺了个床。
data.enText: They made up a bed for me on the sofa.
make up for sth
to do sth that corrects a bad situation

data.chText: 失去一个孩子是任何东西都无法弥补的。
data.enText: Nothing can make up for the loss of a child.

data.chText: 耽搁了这么久，我们急着想弥补失去的时间。
data.enText: After all the delays, we were anxious to make up for lost time .

data.chText: 她的热情弥补了她经验的不足。
data.enText: Her enthusiasm makes up for her lack of experience.
make up (to sb) for sth
to do sth for sb or give them sth because you have caused them trouble, suffering or disappointment and wish to show that you are sorry

data.chText: 我这样对你，该怎么向你表示歉意呢？
data.enText: How can I make up for the way I've treated you?

data.chText: 我保证我一定会补偿你的。
data.enText: I'll make it up to you , I promise.
make up to sb
to be pleasant to sb, praise them, etc. especially in order to get an advantage for yourself
make up (with sb)
make it up
to end a disagreement with sb and become friends again

data.chText: 你们两个干吗不和好算了？
data.enText: Why don't you two kiss and make up ?
Has he made it up with her yet?
Have they made it up yet?

trans: 力图说成；努力让人相信
开具，填写（支票、收据或订货单）
弥补，补偿（令人不快的遭遇或损失）

tr: the act of mixing cards haphazardly

example: there's a new brand of hero in the movies now
what make of car is that?

tr: act in a certain way so as to acquire

example: Again, the cat had made on the expensive rug
The dog had made in the flower beds
He made a fool of himself at the meeting
Don't make this into a big deal
This invention will make you a millionaire
He will make a splendid father!

tr: change from one form into another
cause to be enjoyable or pleasurable

example: I make the height about 100 feet
It wasn't the problem some people made it

tr: make, formulate, or derive in the mind
example: What do you make of his remarks?

tr: cause to act in a specified manner
example: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa

tr: represent fictitiously, as in a play, or pretend to be or act like

example: A good review by this critic will make your play!

tr: make or cause to be or to become
example: make a mess in one's office

tr: create or design, often in a certain way
example: I did this piece in wood to express my love for the forest

tr: create or manufacture a man-made product
example: We produce more cars than we can sell
The company has been making toys for two centuries

tr: cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally
compel or make somebody or something to act in a certain way
example: People cannot be made to integrate just by passing a law!

tr: make by shaping or bringing together constituents
make by combining materials and parts
example: this little pig made his house out of straw
Some eccentric constructed an electric brassiere warmer

tr: prepare for eating by applying heat
example: can you make me an omelette?
fix breakfast for the guests, please
have, throw, or make a party

tr: gather and light the materials for
reach a destination, either real or abstract
example: We barely made it to the finish line
I have to hit the MAC machine before the weekend starts

tr: reach a goal, e.g., "make the first team"
example: She may not make the grade
work one's way through the crowd
make one's way into the forest
The escaped convict took to the hills
He made to speak but said nothing in the end
She made as if to say hello to us

tr: earn on some commercial or business transaction
example: How much do you make a month in your new job?
She earns a lot in her new job
this merger brought in lots of money
She was named Head of the Committee
She was made president of the club

tr: form by assembling individuals or constituents
to compose or represent:"This wall forms the background of the stage setting"

example: This salary increase makes no difference to my standard of living

tr: be or be capable of being changed or made into
example: He will make a fine father
This wool makes into a nice sweater

value.def: You can use make with a wide range of nouns to indicate that someone performs an action or says something. For example, if you make a suggestion, you suggest something.

example.ex: I'd just like to make a comment...
example.tran: 我只想稍加评论。

example.ex: I made a few phone calls...
example.tran: 我打了几个电话。

example.ex: I think you're making a serious mistake...
example.tran: 我认为你正在犯一个严重的错误。

example.ex: The Pope said the world had made some progress towards peace in 1991...
example.tran: 教皇称1991年全世界在争取和平方面有所进展。

example.ex: Science and technology have made major changes to the way we live...
example.tran: 科技极大地改变了我们的生活方式。

example.ex: She had made us an offer too good to refuse.
example.tran: 她开出的条件好得让我们难以回绝。

value.tran: (与大量名词连用，表示做动作、说某事等)做出，作出

value.def: You can use make with certain nouns to indicate that someone does something well or badly. For example, if you make a success of something, you do it successfully, and if you make a mess of something, you do it very badly.

example.ex: Apparently he made a mess of his  audition...
example.tran: 看样子他把试镜搞砸了。

example.ex: Are you really going to make a better job of it this time?
example.tran: 这一次你真的能做得更好吗？

value.tran: (与某些名词连用)把…做(好)，把…搞(糟)

value.def: If you make as if to do something or make to do something, you behave in a way that makes it seem that you are just about to do it.

example.ex: Mary made as if to protest, then hesitated...
example.tran: 玛丽好像要抗议，却又犹豫了。

example.ex: He made to chase Davey, who ran back laughing.
example.tran: 他假装要去追赶一边往回跑一边大笑的戴维。

value.tran: 摆出…的姿态;做出…的样子

value.def: In cricket, if a player makes a particular number of runs, they score that number of runs. In baseball or American football, if a player makes a particular score, they achieve that score.

example.ex: He made 1,972 runs for the county.
example.tran: 他为本郡赢得了1,972分。

value.tran: (在板球、棒球、橄榄球比赛中)得(分)

value.def: If you make do with something, you use or have it instead of something else that you do not have, although it is not as good.

example.ex: Why make do with a copy if you can afford the genuine article?...
example.tran: 要是买得起真品，为什么还要拿复制品来凑合呢？

example.ex: We're a bit low on bed linen. You'll have to make do.
example.tran: 我们的床单有些次，您将就着用吧。

value.def: If you make like you are doing something, you act as if you are doing it, and if you make like someone, you act as if you are that person.

example.ex: Bob makes like he's a fish blowing bubbles.
example.tran: 鲍勃装成一条吐泡泡的鱼。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, PHR cl, PHR n

usage_note.note: Make is used in a large number of expressions which are explained under other words in this dictionary. For example, the expression ‘to make sense’ is explained at ‘sense’.
usage_note.translation: make 用于构成大量的短语，其释义列于本词典的其他词条下，如 to make sense 的释义见 sense。

value.def: If something makes you do something, it causes you to do it.

example.ex: Grit from the highway made him cough...
example.tran: 公路上扬起的沙子呛得他咳嗽起来。

example.ex: The white tips of his shirt collar made him look like a choirboy...
example.tran: 衬衫的白色尖领使他看上去像个唱诗班的男童。

example.ex: I was made to feel guilty and irresponsible.
example.tran: 我被弄得心生内疚，觉得自己很不负责任。

value.def: If you make someone do something, you force them to do it.

example.ex: Mama made him clean up the plate...
example.tran: 妈妈要他把盘子洗干净。

example.ex: You can't make me do anything...
example.tran: 你不能强迫我做任何事情。

example.ex: They were made to pay $8.8 million in taxes.
example.tran: 他们被迫缴纳880万美元的税款。

value.def: You use make to talk about causing someone or something to be a particular thing or to have a particular quality. For example, to make someone a star means to cause them to become a star, and to make someone angry means to cause them to become angry.

example.ex: ...James Bond, the role that made him a star...
example.tran: 詹姆斯·邦德——这个使他一举成名的角色

example.ex: He  returned to Chicago, and made it his base for the rest of his life...
example.tran: 他回到了芝加哥，在那里度过了余生。

example.ex: She made life very difficult for me...
example.tran: 她使我的日子变得举步维艰。

example.ex: She's made it obvious that she's appalled by me...
example.tran: 她坦言被我吓着了。

example.ex: Rationing has made it easier to find some products like eggs, butter and meat...
example.tran: 定量配给使得购买鸡蛋、黄油和肉类等产品更加便捷。

example.ex: Does your film make a hero of Jim Garrison?
example.tran: 您的影片是否将杰姆·加里森塑造成一名英雄人物？

value.tran: 使成为(某种人或物);使具有(某种特性)

value.def: If you say that one thing or person makes another seem, for example, small, stupid, or good, you mean that they cause them to seem small, stupid, or good in comparison, even though they are not.

example.ex: They live in fantasy worlds which make Euro Disney seem uninventive...
example.tran: 他们生活在幻想的世界里，相形之下连欧洲迪士尼乐园都显得毫无创意。

example.ex: Since he came to live with me, we have been subject to a campaign of spite and revenge which makes Lady Sarah appear angelic by comparison.
example.tran: 自从他来与我同住，我们之间便摩擦不断;相比之下，萨拉夫人倒显得一副菩萨心肠。

value.def: If you make yourself understood, heard, or known, you succeed in getting people to understand you, hear you, or know that you are there.

example.ex: Aron couldn't speak Polish. I made myself understood with difficulty...
example.tran: 阿伦不会说波兰语，我为了让他明白我的话很是费了一番力气。

example.ex: He almost had to shout to make himself heard above the music.
example.tran: 为了压过音乐声，他几乎得大声喊才能让人听见。

value.tran: 使自己(被理解、听见、知晓等)

value.def: If you make someone something, you appoint them to a particular job, role, or position.

example.ex: Mr Blair made him transport minister...
example.tran: 布莱尔先生任命他为交通部长。

example.ex: If I am made chairman, I hope Simon will stay on as my trusted lieutenant.
example.tran: 如果我当主席，我希望西蒙作为我信赖的副官，继续留在我的身边。

value.def: If you make something into something else, you change it in some way so that it becomes that other thing.

example.ex: We made it into a beautiful home...
example.tran: 我们把这里变成了美丽的家园。

example.ex: Her bestseller 'Peachtree Road' is soon to be made into a television mini-series.
example.tran: 她的畅销小说《桃树路》不久将被拍成一部电视系列短剧。

value.def: To make a total or score a particular amount means to increase it to that amount.

example.ex: This makes the total cost of the bulb and energy £27...
example.tran: 这使灯泡与电费合计为27英镑。

example.ex: Lupescu scored from 20 yards and then Balint made it 4-0.
example.tran: 卢佩斯库在20码处射门得分，接着巴林特将比分扩大为4比0。

value.tran: 使(总数)升为;使(分数)达到

value.def: When someone makes a friend or an enemy, someone becomes their friend or their enemy, often because of a particular thing they have done.

example.ex: Lorenzo was a natural leader who made friends easily...
example.tran: 洛伦佐是天生的领袖，善于交友。

example.ex: He was unruly in class and made an enemy of most of his teachers.
example.tran: 他因上课调皮捣蛋而成为大多数老师的眼中钉。

value.def: If someone makes something of themselves or makes something of their life, they become successful.

example.ex: My father lived long enough to see that I'd made something of myself...
example.tran: 父亲在有生之年见证了我出人头地的那一天。

example.ex: The nuns who taught him urged him to make something of his life and he did.
example.tran: 教他念书的修女激励他努力上进，他最终取得了成功。

value.def: To make something means to produce, construct, or create it.

example.ex: She made her own bread...
example.tran: 她自己做面包。

example.ex: Nissan now makes cars at two plants in Europe...
example.tran: 目前日产公司在欧洲有两家工厂生产汽车。

example.ex: Having curtains made professionally can be costly...
example.tran: 找专业公司制作窗帘会非常昂贵。

example.ex: They make compost out of all kinds of waste.
example.tran: 他们用各种废料制造堆肥。

value.def: If someone makes a film or television programme, they are involved in creating or producing it.

example.ex: We are making a film about wildlife.
example.tran: 我们正在拍摄一部关于野生动物的影片。

example.ex: ...the film 'Queen Christina', made in 1934.
example.tran: 1934年出品的影片《克里斯蒂娜女王》

value.tran: 拍摄(电影);制作(电视节目)

value.def: If you make a meal or a drink, you prepare it.

example.ex: You wash while I make some lunch...
example.tran: 你洗一下，我去做午饭。

example.ex: Would you like me to make us all a coffee?
example.tran: 我给大家冲杯咖啡好吗？

value.def: If you make a note or list, you write something down in that form.

example.ex: Mr Perry made a note in his book...
example.tran: 佩里先生在他的书上作了一个注解。

example.ex: Make a list of your questions beforehand.
example.tran: 事先列出你的问题。

value.def: If you make rules or laws, you decide what these should be.

example.ex: The police don't make the laws, they merely enforce them...
example.tran: 警察并不制定法律，只是负责执行。

example.ex: The only person who makes rules in this house is me.
example.tran: 这座房子里就我说了算。

value.def: If you make money, you get it by working for it, by selling something, or by winning it.

example.ex: I think every business's goal is to make money...
example.tran: 我认为各家公司的目的都是赚钱。

example.ex: How much did we make?...
example.tran: 我们挣了多少？

example.ex: Can it be moral to make so much money out of a commodity which is essential to life?
example.tran: 靠着一种生活必需品赚这么多钱，这在道德上说得过去吗？

value.def: If something makes something else, it is responsible for the success of that thing.

example.ex: What really makes the book are the beautiful designs.
example.tran: 真正让这本书大获成功的是它精美的设计。

value.tran: (某事物)使(其他事物)变得成功

value.def: The make of something such as a car or radio is the name of the company that made it.

example.ex: The only car parked outside is a black Saab — a different make.
example.tran: 停在外面的只有一辆黑色的萨博——不是一个牌子的车。

example.ex: ...a certain make of wristwatch.
example.tran: 某种品牌的手表

value.def: If you say that someone is on the make, you disapprove of them because they are trying to get a lot of money or power, possibly by illegal or immoral methods.
value.tran: （可能以非法或不道德手段）拼命追求金钱(或权力）

value.def: You can use make to say that someone or something has the right qualities for a particular task or role. For example, if you say that someone will make a good politician, you mean that they have the right qualities to be a good politician.

example.ex: She'll make a good actress, if she gets the right training...
example.tran: 如果训练得当，她会成为一名出色的演员。

example.ex: You've a very good idea there. It will make a good book...
example.tran: 你构思很好，可用来写一本佳作。

example.ex: Instructors decided he would never make a pilot...
example.tran: 教练断定他永远也当不了飞行员。

example.ex: I'm very fond of Maurice and I'd make him a good wife.
example.tran: 我非常喜欢莫里斯，我会成为他的贤内助的。

value.def: If people make a particular pattern such as a line or a circle, they arrange themselves in this way.

example.ex: A group of people made a circle around the Pentagon.
example.tran: 一群人在五角大楼四周围成一圈。

value.def: You can use make to say what two numbers add up to.

example.ex: Four twos make eight...
example.tran: 4乘以2等于8。

example.ex: He is adding three aircraft carriers—that makes six in all.
example.tran: 他准备增加3艘航空母舰，这样一来总共就有6艘。

value.def: If someone makes a particular team or makes a particular high position, they do so well that they are put in that team or get that position.

example.ex: The athletes are just happy to make the British team...
example.tran: 运动员们很乐意加入英国国家队。

example.ex: He knew he was never going to make director.
example.tran: 他明白自己永远也当不了导演。

value.tran: 成为…的一员;加入;谋得（高级职务）

value.def: If you make a place in or by a particular time, you get there in or by that time, often with some difficulty.

example.ex: They were trying to make New Orleans by nightfall.
example.tran: 他们力图在黄昏前赶到新奥尔良。

value.def: If you make it somewhere, you succeed in getting there, especially in time to do something.

example.ex: So you did make it to America, after all.
example.tran: 那么，你终究还是成功地来到了美国。

example.ex: ...the hostages who never made it home...
example.tran: 再也没能重返家园的人质

example.ex: I just made it!
example.tran: 我可到了！

value.tran: (及时)到达（尤指来得及做某事）

value.def: If you make it, you are successful in achieving something difficult, or in surviving through a very difficult period.

example.ex: I believe I have the talent to make it...
example.tran: 我相信自己有成功的天分。

example.ex: You're brave and courageous. You can make it.
example.tran: 你勇敢无畏，一定会获得成功。

value.def: If you cannot make it, you are unable to attend an event that you have been invited to.

example.ex: 'I can't make it,' she said. 'That's Mother's Day.'...
example.tran: “我无法赴约了，”她说，“那天是母亲节。”

example.ex: He hadn't been able to make it to our dinner.
example.tran: 他没能出席我们的晚宴。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, usu with brd-neg, oft PHR <l>to</l> n

value.def: You use make it when saying what you calculate or guess an amount to be.

example.ex: All I want to know is how many T-shirts Jim Martin has got. I make it three...
example.tran: 我就想知道吉姆·马丁一共有多少件T恤衫。我猜他有3件。

example.ex: I make the total for the year £9,599.
example.tran: 我算出当年的总额为9,599英镑。

value.def: You use make it when saying what time your watch says it is.

example.ex: I make it nearly 9.30...
example.tran: 我的手表显示快9点半了。

example.ex: 'What time d'you make it?' — 'Thirteen past.'
example.tran: “你的表几点？”——“整点过13分钟。”

trans: 开具，填写（支票、收据或订货单）
弥补，补偿（令人不快的遭遇或损失）

queryExplainVideo.detail: Make & do 的四大用法和区别
